text: St. Matthews School, also known as St. Matthew School, is a historic Rosenwald School building located near Raleigh, Wake County, North Carolina. It was built in 1922, and is a one-story, frame building with a hipped roof and sheathed in weatherboard. It sits on a concrete block foundation. The school closed in 1949. St. Matthews Baptist Church owns the school and uses the building as a meeting hall. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 2001. ==References== Category:Rosenwald schools in North Carolina Category:School buildings on the National Register of Historic Places in North Carolina Category:School buildings completed in 1922 Category:Schools in Wake County, North Carolina Category:National Register of Historic Places in Wake County, North Carolina
title: St. Matthews School (Raleigh, North Carolina)
